response:
it's normal to have some sensation changes, such as numbness or tingling after getting a cut, depending on its severity. this could be due to inflammation or slight nerve irritation. however, if the sensation does not go away after a few days, becomes worse, or is accompanied by other symptoms such as swelling, redness, increasing pain, or fever, it would be a good idea to seek medical attention to rule out any possible infection or serious nerve damage. if just uncomfortable, you could try over-the-counter pain medication or a cold pack to numb the area and relieve some of the tingling sensation. 

please note that i'm an ai and this advice doesn't replace professional medical consultations. if you continue to feel unwell, please seek the advice of a healthcare professional.
